Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 06:08PM sweetjolieblon wrote: It is so odd.  I now have a blurry spot in my vision that comes and goes.  I never had it before chemo.  Probably an "Ocular Aura".  The thing is that when I had my first chemo that night I had an incident of black bloctchy vision and I could not see where I was going.  I had to feel my way to and from the bathroom.  It lasted for some time then resolved and reoccurred a short time with the 2nd chemo but never again.  Now I have this thing that comes and goes and they say it is odd.  Odd?  I swear it is probably from chemo  but who knows.  Anyone else have this!!!

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 04:15PM sweetjolieblon wrote: My bilateral mastectomy is scheduled for 18 March 2011.  I am to have immediate reconstruction with expanders.  I am to have a Sentinel Node Injection prior to surgery.  My dx is DCIS intermediate to high, Comedo, solid and cribriform with central necrosis/lumpectomy which did not come back clean.  I had an MRI and an area was seen just outside of the excisional site which is suspicious of cancer.  Because I am having mastectomy, I will need to wait and see about that area.  I am so appreciative of this wonderful site with its fountain of knowledge and support.
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom
